page.title: 07LOCAL HISTORY.CALCOT,READING
page.content: Calcot has a wonderful history,with evidence from most major periods.A New Stone Age knife was found near Calcot mill.A Bronze Age spearhead was dicovered near to the M4.Iron Age people lived in the area near to Little Heath School.There was a Roman villa on Pinsents Hill.The artifacts are held in Reading museum.Saxons and Danes fought through Calcot.The Normans were here at Nunhide. There has been a mill in Calcot probably since Saxon times.The mill was leased by Henry V111 to local people.and Elizabeth leased it to her court favourite! Roundheads and Cavaliers were here. There are many fine houses in Calcot,but non finer than the manor house,around which the 'Ballard of the Berkshire lady' is set.
